TypeSignature.Value: type IScheduledExecutorService = interface interface IExecutorService interface IExecutor interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable
public interface IScheduledExecutorService : IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutorService

.class public interface auto ansi abstract IScheduledExecutorService implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutor, class Java.Util.Concurrent.IExecutorService, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: An ExecutorService that can schedule commands to run after a given delay, or to execute periodically.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the time from now to delay execution
the time unit of the delay parameter
Docs.summary: Creates and executes a one-shot action that becomes enabled after the given delay.
Docs.returns: a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the task and whose get() method will return null upon completion

Docs.exception: if the task cannot be scheduled for execution

MemberSignature.Value: abstract member ScheduleAtFixedRate : Java.Lang.IRunnable * int64 * int64 * Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit -> Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture
public Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture? ScheduleAtFixedRate (Java.Lang.IRunnable? command, long initialDelay, long period, Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit? unit);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture ScheduleAtFixedRate(class Java.Lang.IRunnable command, int64 initialDelay, int64 period, class Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit) cil managed

Docs.param: the time to delay first execution
the time unit of the initialDelay and period parameters
Docs.summary: Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is, executions will commence after initialDelay, then initialDelay + period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on.
Docs.returns: a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the series of repeated tasks. The future's Future#get() get() method will never return normally, and will throw an exception upon task cancellation or abnormal termination of a task execution.

format.a: Java documentation for java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate(java.lang.Runnable, long, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the task cannot be scheduled for execution
if period less than or equal to zero

MemberSignature.Value: abstract member ScheduleWithFixedDelay : Java.Lang.IRunnable * int64 * int64 * Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit -> Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture
public Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture? ScheduleWithFixedDelay (Java.Lang.IRunnable? command, long initialDelay, long delay, Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit? unit);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Util.Concurrent.IScheduledFuture ScheduleWithFixedDelay(class Java.Lang.IRunnable command, int64 initialDelay, int64 delay, class Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit) cil managed

Docs.param: the time to delay first execution
the delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next
the time unit of the initialDelay and delay parameters
Docs.summary: Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next.
Docs.returns: a ScheduledFuture representing pending completion of the series of repeated tasks. The future's Future#get() get() method will never return normally, and will throw an exception upon task cancellation or abnormal termination of a task execution.

format.a: Java documentation for java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleWithFixedDelay(java.lang.Runnable, long, long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit).

Docs.exception: if the task cannot be scheduled for execution
if delay less than or equal to zero
